file_content.text: Must thank you.
To travel with Scorekeeper's Herald is great blessing. I am grateful for honor.
I've seen your prowess as a hunter, Qyzen. I'm glad to have you at my side.
The honor is mine.
Don't thank me just yet. We still have many tasks ahead of us.
This will be a tough journey.
What is to fear? There is hunt; then success, or death.
You don't need to call me that. I'm not anyone's Herald.
I'm really not your "Herald."
I saw on Tython. You are Herald, marked by Scorekeeper. Is so, even if you cannot see.
Fighting Nalen Raloch together. Great, glorious victory.
But was terrible to lose score. To wake up caged, and be nothing.
These points and your score are everything to you, correct?
Explain this "score" again.
Hunt is life. Honorable kill earns points, tallied by Scorekeeper. She sees all.
Bigger score earns glory in afterlife. But capture... erases score. Gone. Is worse than death.
Don't think about that; imagine how good it will feel to reclaim those lost points.
Focus on getting it back.
Yes. Will take time. Many, many points lost.
It was only a number. It's not like you were mutilated when you lost it.
Don't be so melodramatic.
Score is not "number." Is measure of life's worth, Scorekeeper's favor. Without, I do not exist.
But, also gained much on Tython. I met Scorekeeper's Herald. Is all balance.
Have spoken to Elders on Trandosha, Herald.
Lek Svaal told of Veneb's treachery and murder. I thank you, for everything.
But, suddenly having clan to lead? I never, ever sought, Herald, and is all at once.
Don't worry. You're intelligent, capable and devout, exactly the role model they need.
You'll be a great leader.
Names have power. Renaming the clan is a good way to make a clean break with the past.
Picked a clan name yet?
Hmm. "Scorekeeper's Grace"? Or "Herald's Teeth"? Must think on it.
You're all those youngsters have. Do good by them.
No getting out of it now.
Is so much to teach. To honor Scorekeeper, and self. How points are rightly earned. How to be silent, strike sure....
Must have patience. Stalk ignorance, step by step--both clan's, and mine.
You do honor to your goddess, Qyzen. Perhaps she'll grant you points for this.
The Scorekeeper must be proud.
I did only necessary thing. But, yes, is always my hope she smiles on me.
If you ever want advice, I'll be here.
I will help, if you need me.
Is great comfort to have Scorekeeper's Herald at my shoulder.
Someday you'll want to rejoin your clan, and lead them in person.
So one day you'll be leaving.
In time, yes, I will rejoin. But for now, first duty is to you, though clan must be close behind.
Come, Herald. Standing still helps no hunter, or clan. Work is to be done.
Veneb's young clan has returned also. Time with others, on Trandosha, will clear minds. Teach them much.
Where will those young Trandoshans go, without a leader?
What will happen to them?
Join other clans, or strike out alone, to succeed or fail. Same chance for all, Herald.
When the last of his "teachings" are forgotten, Veneb will be too.
Then Veneb will be truly gone.
Is so. He turned back on Scorekeeper, so now is nothing.
It is possible Veneb's methods and ideas will take root, instead of disappearing.
Or they'll pollute others.
Elders are wise, Herald. Over years, have seen such notions come, and always, go.
Has all been great lesson for me. Clan, politics--better left sleeping.
Simple life is mine. Travel, hunt, points. And serving Scorekeeper's Herald.
You don't serve me, Qyzen. We hunt side by side, as equals.
Not a servant. A friend.
I am... no equal of Scorekeeper's Herald. Cannot be. But is... great kindness and courtesy to say.
Thank you, Qyzen. It means a lot to hear you say that.
You honor me.
I speak truth only, Herald. But if truth pleases you, is greater blessing.
If you want a life without complications, you may have picked the wrong traveling companion.
Our lives are rarely simple.
No, Herald. I chose rightly. This I know. As does Scorekeeper.
Come, Herald. Still many points to be gained. Always, there is work.
You have heart of Trandoshan hunter, Herald.
Coming from you, that's quite the compliment, Qyzen.
Thank you.
I say truth.
Perhaps, but my first responsibility is to protect others and the Republic, not gather points.
I must still act as a Jedi.
Is your duty. I know. As Scorekeeper must, to keep hand on your shoulder.
I hope you mean that figuratively, Qyzen.
That's a worrying statement.
Is compliment I mean, Herald.
You learn, test yourself. Spare prey beneath you, for others to hunt.
You know battle, truly; you fight without fear, hunt great evils.
You understand predator and prey have bond. Know when to spare, when to strike.
And you led me to clan. To guide back to Scorekeeper. As long as you need, Herald, I will be here.
You do Scorekeeper honor, as Herald. I wish nothing, than to hunt by your side.
This is a "great goodness." I don't know what to say.
I'm touched, Qyzen.
The ship would never be the same without you.
I'm glad to hear it.
I understand. I can't imagine you settling down to a quiet life.
Retirement wouldn't suit you.
For clan, I could... slow. But to sit and be quiet? Always? Is not for me.
Indeed. I hope is not for me to die in sleep.
I am past middle of life. Not so many years ahead. But plenty to see us win glory.
Now come, Herald. Galaxy moves around us.
Choice is made about Veneb Drassk, treacherous Clan Speaker-to-be. I thought, prayed, then issued ghrajath.
Ghrajath is claim of dispute. Law says, no one becomes Clan Speaker with ghrajath unresolved.
Veneb must meet me and resolve, peacefully or no, or lose prize he kills and schemes for.
So you've not only trapped Veneb into facing you, you've placed the law on your side. Good work.
That was a clever idea.
Law and justice must hunt, or is only chaos.
This can't have been easy for you, to go against the Scorekeeper's wishes.
You've struggled with this.
Cannot know this is right thing. But, is necessary thing. If is wrong, I ask Scorekeeper's forgiveness.
Do you really think Veneb is going to respect your people's laws, after what he's done?
He'll probably just ignore it.
Perhaps yes, perhaps no. But Elders respect law, and them, Veneb cannot defy.
Have sent word, through Elders. I meet Veneb, and clan, on ruined world of Taris.
If Veneb will not surrender peacefully, what happens then?
Will you fight him?
Is great evil, to kill brother Trandoshans. But Veneb is criminal. I talk first, then decide.
Maybe I could help settle this dispute.
I should go, as a peacemaker.
Yes. Yes, you are Herald of Scorekeeper. If you witness, all is done in her eyes.
If he's bringing his clan, this would be the perfect opportunity for an ambush.
You know he'll betray you.
Is true. But you hunted the Jedi Tykan on Taris. We know terrain, and match Veneb's strength.
Please accompany, as Scorekeeper's Herald. All must be done rightly.
We meet Veneb's clansman, Brek, on Taris. Soon. Veneb must answer for crimes.
Herald. Have sought out this Veneb Drassk, clan leader who used Wookiees to kill. But is... troubling things I find.
Veneb has fattened on blood of rivals. Recruited clan of young ones, built many alliances. Is respected.
Is so respected, Veneb may become Clan Speaker to Elders--position of great power.
Why is being a Clan Speaker so important?
What's a Clan Speaker?
Clan Speaker represents all clans to Elders. Should become so by hard work, trustworthiness, not tricks!
Surely he can't be unchallenged--someone must know what he has done.
But he's a murderer!
Seems only hunter's trick Veneb knows is covering tracks.
If we go to the Elders and explain Veneb's crimes, they'd never make him Clan Speaker.
We must expose his misdeeds.
Is no evidence we have. And is... more complex.
Veneb has begun rites to become Clan Speaker, and ensure Scorekeeper's favor.
Veneb is justice's prey--I feel this. But... Scorekeeper knows Veneb's heart, past and future, and still favors.
If I accuse, if I stand against Veneb, is standing against Scorekeeper's wishes.
If the Scorekeeper sees Veneb's heart, then she must also see yours. She understands you can't let him escape judgment.
She knows you'd seek justice.
Am I to say, "I am judge"? To say, "I am wiser, because I feel"?
Allowing Veneb to become Clan Speaker would defile both your people, and the Scorekeeper.
You can't simply do nothing.
Good hunter wastes nothing. Perhaps Scorekeeper sees purpose, even for broken thing like Veneb.
If you wish to pursue this, and accuse Veneb, then you must accept that possibility.
Perhaps you would.
I am hunter, not Elder. I seek points, give life to Scorekeeper--is all I need.
But if I belong to her, what is belonging for? What good is to see and do nothing?
Is much to think on.
You wanted to talk, Qyzen?
Herald, soft thing is Mako, information seller I spoke of. To help us find treacherous Trandoshan we hunt.
Not if you keep calling me a soft thing. I remember what that means, y'know.
Huh. Qyzen says you're a herald? You look like a Jedi to me.
According to Qyzen, I'm the Scorekeeper's Herald. It's a long story.
It's a Trandoshan title.
As nicknames go, I'd look for something a little... snappier.
We're looking for a Trandoshan called Veneb.
We need you to find someone.
And all you know is his name? Sure, I like a challenge.
Those who trust their eyes over their intelligence often regret it.
Appearances can be deceptive.
Sheesh. You could write a book of those--you'd make a fortune.
Mako, we hunt Trandoshan named Veneb. He sold information to Wookiees, got hunters killed. Is very important we find.
Hunt, hunt, hunt. You know, if you hunted crooks instead of animals, you'd be a household name.
Okay. I got a "Veneb Drassk." Trandoshan, former bounty hunter--retired. That him?
Going from hunting for money to selling information is a small step. He may be the man we want.
That sounds plausible.
Even the Jedi Archives rarely recover information that quickly.
How did you do that so fast?
I'm all wired up to the HoloNet. If it's out there, it's up here.
Perhaps. Where is he?
I just need a location.
No idea. HoloNet's got a little more.
After he retired, this Veneb became some bigshot Trandoshan clan leader. Just... suddenly shot up the ranks.
Oh. Shot up the ranks, after a lot of his rivals "went missing." Usually on hunts. Interesting, huh?
By Scorekeeper! Explains all. Wookiee Gwarror wanted Trandoshans to hunt, Veneb wanted dead rivals....
Veneb identified Trandoshans going through shko-yagu, ones who challenged his power, and told Gwarror who to kill.
They were working together.
Veneb wasn't helping Gwarror for credits, he was maneuvering himself into becoming a clan leader.
This is about clan politics.
Veneb found a perfect way to dispose of his rivals. Who'd think twice about Wookiees and Trandoshans killing each other?
Quite a clever strategy.
That's all I've got on this Veneb. But it should be enough for you two to find him.
So Qyzen. We're square now, right? No more "favor is owed"?
You've been very helpful, I think we can consider this even.
I think that's fair.
Yes, no more is owed. Was kindness, Mako.
What do you think? This is your friend, and your favor.
It's up to you, Qyzen.
Is repaid, Mako. Is great kindness you have done.
Hey, now. Don't go soft on me. I like you fine as you are.
See you around, Qyzen. Take care of yourself, and your Herald.
That's not much to go on. I think she could still be of use to you.
Don't. You might need her.
Hmm. Is so. If hunt fails, will need you again, Mako.
Fine, fine. But next time I owe you a favor, I'm giving it an expiry date.
If Veneb is clan leader, Elders back home will know where to find. Snare tightens, Herald.
Herald, Mako sends no word yet. But shko-yagu is complete.
Body, mind are renewed. New skin and muscle grow.
Was all earned in pain. But am strong enough now to hunt for rest of my life.
I must admit, I'm not sure what the average Trandoshan's lifespan is.
How long will that be?
Average? I passed thirty-second year; to live past fifty is rare thing. I am not Jedi, to go on and on forever.
Why not find a mate and raise a family?
You could always settle down.
Hatchlings, raising, squabbling? Hmph. I need only hunt.
I'm glad you'll be at your peak. I can't do without you.
Good. I need you.
Is a goodness to be needed so.
You have been... good example, Herald. I push harder, train harder to match.
Will be worthy of you, and to serve Scorekeeper. This is new beginning.
Have thought of Gwarror, Wookiee who hunted my people.
Lek Svaal helped recover Gwarror's pelt. Is impressive. For my people, such Wookiee pelt is exceptional courting gift.
As Herald, I offer pelt to you. Perhaps your mate, Lieutenant Iresso, would like?
That's... very generous, Qyzen. But perhaps you should keep it.
Um, no thanks.
I think Felix prefers women who don't surprise him with Wookiee pelts.
I really doubt that.
Truly? Is unworthy mate for Scorekeeper's Herald, then.
As Herald, I offer pelt to you. Perhaps your mate, little Nadia, would like?
A... generous gift, but I cannot accept it, even for Nadia.
No, thank you.
I offer gift to win any heart, Herald, and you turn away. Is shame.
Nadia's not the sort of woman who truly appreciates a Wookiee pelt. She's funny that way.
It's not really her thing.
Ah. Is so hard to please females.
Thank you, Qyzen. What a thoughtful gift.
All right, I'll take it.
I will scrape pelt, salt and prepare--will take time, to be perfect for Herald's mate.
Missed chance by sparing him. Pelt of Gwarror would be exceptional courting gift, for your mate.
So, if you gave such a pelt to a female of your species--?
Is that a Trandoshan custom?
Would show strength of love. Perhaps gain her favor.
We have to focus on tracking down Veneb, the one who told Gwarror which Trandoshans to hunt.
We have a Trandoshan to find.
I don't need a pile of mangy Wookiee fur to win anyone's heart.
I can manage fine without one.
If you deny your mate best things, Herald, is false love you have.
We must attend to hunt. Veneb, Trandoshan who betrayed hunters to Gwarror--we must find, and punish.
Is strange to hunt with no tracks or scent. Must find Veneb's trail, but even Lek knew nothing.
We only know Veneb's name and what he's done. That's not enough.
We need more information.
Knowledge. Yes. I know where to get.
You've hunted across this galaxy for years. Surely someone owes you a favor?
You must have some contacts.
Yes. Yes, is so.
If he wants Trandoshan hunters dead, we can set an ambush.
Let's draw Veneb out.
If Veneb knows of Gwarror's dying, will be skittish, hard to snare.
Is good idea, but Gwarror could have given Veneb warnings.
Hmm. Once, I was bounty hunter for man called Braden. He had daughter, Mako--his eyes and ears.
Mako was soft thing, but knew of trading information, of hunts and hunters. And to me, she owes debt.
What debt does she owe?
Why?
Is private thing, Herald. Debt exists, all that matters.
If Mako might know something of Veneb, let's not waste any time.
Then we should talk to her.
Information brokers tend to be expensive; I'd much rather pay with a favor.
Good, so she'll work for free.
Braden and Mako moved often. May take time to find. I begin.
Molt is over. I am living thing again, Herald.
Does this mean your shko-yagu is over?
Is your rite finished?
You must feel much better now that your ordeal is over.
Congratulations.
Is one last part.
Seems like a lot of effort for no visible difference.
You still look the same.
Is within, Herald. Already body is changing.
To begin final stage of shko-yagu, I ate piece of molted skin.
Life and death, all feed on each other. To eat piece of molt, proves I know this.
So, the person you were nourishes the person you're becoming.
The past, feeding the future?
Yes, Herald, is exactly so.
Trandoshan skin is incredibly tough. Can you even digest it?
That can't be good for you.
Is not easy.
Just when I think you're civilized, you start eating pieces of yourself.
How disgusting.
No, Herald, of old self. Should not be wasted.
Skin provides nourishment for last changes, but is... uncomfortable. Like stone in the belly. But, must focus.
Have spoken to Lek Svaal again, little hunter from Tatooine. Says hunting opportunity still waits on Alderaan.
Now I am living thing, with points to gain, would be goodness to go.
Did Lek say what sort of hunt this would be?
What "opportunity" is this?
No, only is "chance of lifetime hunt."
It'll be a good way to celebrate your return to life.
Then we should go.
You shouldn't go hunting if you're still feeling ill.
You said you were sick.
Exercise would be help, Herald.
Have endured sickness of nakkis leaf medicine, this is little more. Exercise would be help.
Please. I have fitness to hunt. And still have points to regain.
This is a special opportunity; you should take full advantage of it.
We should go, then.
I suppose we can go. But if you feel any worse, let me know.
All right. But stay well.
Thank you, Herald. We meet Lek Svaal on Alderaan, soon. Or chance will be lost.
If we have time to spare, perhaps we can make a detour to Alderaan.
I'll think about it.
Lek said chance is soon lost, Herald. But is your starship. I must accept.
Shko-yagu continues, and rebirth begins, with Scorekeeper's blessing.
Has been no sickness, and molt goes smoothly. Is thanks to your medicine, Herald.
That's what friends are for, Qyzen.
You don't need to thank me.
I... I still hope to repay one day, Herald.
I couldn't risk you keeling over in the middle of battle.
I needed you fit for combat.
Then was very wise. Capture again would be disaster.
Nakkis leaf medicine brings... pains. But I endure. Has caused molting, as was meant.
You may raid our medical supplies--take what you need.
I hope you feel better.
Sickness will not last, Herald.
How long does it take to shed your skin?
When does your molt finish?
Normally is few days. But this is deep molt, will take longer. Am sorry if I scratch.
Your goddess seems to delight in forcing you to risk your life.
This is a sadistic ritual.
My life is Scorekeeper's. Without challenge, I am soft thing.
Herald, until skin is fully shed, before Scorekeeper I am not dead, not alive.
For short time, I gain no points, until rebirth is complete.
After you've completed your rebirth, what happens then?
What's the next stage?
Shko-yagu nears end. Need molted skin to complete fully. I will explain when is time.
What's the rationale behind that?
Seems like an odd restriction.
Is... strange question you ask. How could thing not dead or alive gain points?
Whether you're gaining points or not, I need you to defend my back.
But you'll still be fighting.
I know duty, Herald.
Is shame. Remember Lek Svaal? Little one from Tatooine, who hunted Dusk Shadow?
He called, to speak of great hunting chance on Alderaan. But I cannot gain points, so is not proper.
Lek said opportunity would soon pass. But perhaps when shko-yagu is over, will still be time.
Herald, I... would be goodness to speak with you.
Pardon my asking, but are you feeling alright?
You don't look well.
Am fine. Only... hungry.
Talk about whatever you wish, Qyzen.
Of course.
If you have something to say, out with it.
Then speak.
No point to make. But would be distraction, from fasting.
Is part of shko-yagu, rite of passage, to deny food. But, always when I hunger, I hunt. To hunger for days is new.
Let's take your mind off it. Explain this rite of passage a little more.
Talk about your shko-yagu.
Shko-yagu marks mature hunter. Kills earn greater points. After, some retire, become Elders. Others pursue hunt until death.
This hunger is just another foe, one you defeat with strength and focus.
You can handle it.
Is true, Herald. I will remember.
If you could eat, what would you have?
What are you craving?
Toasted mealworms would be goodness. Bowl after bowl.
Hmm. Has been long since I heard of anyone completing shko-yagu.
Is rare for hunters to live long enough for shko-yagu, true. But none completing for years? Has never been so.
In turbulent times, the first changes are often cultural. Maybe your people's customs are evolving.
Traditions do change.
Shko-yagu is honored rite of passage. Would be shame to lose.
What has changed, do you think?
Any idea why?
Is dangerous time, Herald, and shko-yagu is hard. Perhaps hunters lose heart.
There's been little opportunity for you to catch up on the news from your people.
Or, you just haven't heard.
Is true, but word travels.
After fasting, shko-yagu continues. I drink nakkis leaf medicine on empty stomach. Force skin to molt--is rebirth.
Such medicine would certainly induce a molt. Along with vomiting, fever and burning pain in the sinuses.
But nakkis leaf is poisonous.
Is part of shko-yagu. Is tradition. Sickness is nothing.
I could make you a medicine from our supplies that will induce molting, without any side effects.
I know a safer alternative.
Nakkis leaf is tradition. But... perhaps Scorekeeper speaks through you, Herald?
I will trust. Make this medicine.
Drink this in some hot water. You'll start molting by tomorrow.
Is great kindness you do, Herald. I will not forget.
Don't use too much of the herb, and eat a good meal as soon as you can.
Very well. Please be careful.
Am not your hatchling, Herald. But, you mean kindness. Thank you.
If you want to make yourself ill because some tradition demands it, that's your business.
Fine. Do whatever you like.
Yes, Herald. My business, and Scorekeeper's.
Does it hurt when you shed your skin?
Molting sounds painful.
I shed yearly. No pain, but... itching. This is special deep molt, to purify.
Will be fast molt, I hope. My thanks for talk.
If you're going to be shedding skin on the ship, do it somewhere near the cargo ramp.
Just don't make a mess.
Should I sleep in cargo hold, too? Like old times.
Is great peace in me since visiting father's bones, Herald. Thank you.
Have spoken to Lek Svaal, young hunter we met. Was shocked the Dusk Shadow could be slain without tricks.
Lek promises to be worthier. Scorekeeper will judge.
Lek needs guidance from a more experienced hunter, like you.
You should mentor him.
I... perhaps, but I am hunter, no teacher. Lek must become on his own.
I'm glad Lek managed to learn this lesson without being maimed by the Dusk Shadow, or his own explosives.
At least he wasn't hurt.
Pain teaches well. But yes, hatchling mistakes should be small.
Lek doesn't have the skill to survive a proper hunt.
He won't last five minutes.
Then Scorekeeper will have judged. Though, would be a goodness if he lives.
Herald, there is... something. Seeing father's bones reminded. I am coming to middle of life.
This time begins new life phase, marked by rite of passage called "shko-yagu." I must fast, contemplate, train.
So once your shko-yagu is completed, what will be different?
How will this change you?
Skin regrows and matures. Body grows new muscle, to stay strong.
I've never heard of the shko-yagu before.
I know nothing of this ritual.
Is rare for hunters to live long. So shko-yagu is rare also.
If pursuing this "shko-yagu" doesn't interfere with your service to me, do as you wish.
I'll still need you to fight.
I must hunt throughout shko-yagu--shows devotion to Scorekeeper. But must be cautious.
Shko-yagu is... painful time. Must be on guard, always. Pain must not distract.
I thank for patience, Herald. Have thought on wrongness I feel, and have answer.
Is because of capture on Tython. I suffer shame over loss of my score.
I must make special effort; purge all disgrace, and make amends to Scorekeeper.
You don't need to "purge" anything. This sense of shame is all in your mind.
Qyzen, you're not disgraced.
If I think I am shamed, is same as being shamed. Yuon taught this.
Make amends, how?
You're regaining your score, serving her Herald--what more does this Scorekeeper want?
She seems very hard to please.
Scorekeeper's favor is life or death, even if I still breathe. I must appease.
My father was great hunter. Died with exceptional score, hunting in sands of Tatooine.
I must find father's bones in Tatooine desert, pay homage to him and points. This will please Scorekeeper, and end disgrace.
The Scorekeeper's Herald should witness such an act of reverence.
I should come with you.
Would be great kindness, Herald. Thank you.
Tatooine's deserts are vast; there must be thousands of bones out there.
That'll be a difficult search.
I know beginning place. And Scorekeeper will guide.
If it doesn't, you'll need another way to keep the Scorekeeper happy.
I hope this works.
Is no wrongness to honor father. If nothing else, is good beginning to redeem myself.
I ask that you accompany, Herald, as witness. Then Scorekeeper cannot fail to see.
We should search on Tatooine soon. Shame grows by the day.
Is strange, Herald. I feel... wrongness. All around, everywhere.
You do not feel?
You could have picked up some Trandoshan sickness on our travels.
Maybe you're ill.
No, is no sickness of body.
There's no tremor in the Force that I can perceive.
I sense nothing wrong.
Hmm. Perhaps is not of your Force.
I really don't have time for this.
Just deal with it, Qyzen.
Hunter must listen to feelings, or dies fast.
I take time to think, Herald. Please excuse.
Herald, I bartered away small hunt trophies. Two ghest skins, rack of horax teeth.
I earned credits, but would like you to have. As tribute, for Scorekeeper's Herald.
Thank you, Qyzen, but I won't take money for trophies you claimed.
I can't take what you earned.
Surely the Scorekeeper's Herald has no need for credits.
No tribute is necessary.
If you wish, Herald. Shall save for future hunts, then.
Very well. The Scorekeeper surely smiles on your generosity.
Credits? Hand them over.
Is good to give thanks.
Once, I saved credits to be smuggled onto Kashyyyk. Is Wookiee homeworld. Deep forests, and Shadowlands full of monsters.
Three weeks to stalk through Shadowlands. Gained dozen pelts of Wookiee hunters. Was magnificent.
The Wookiees are a noble people--not animals for you to kill.
How could you hunt Wookiees?
Are prey of choice for us, Herald. Silverback Wookiee pelt earns many, many points.
A Trandoshan in Wookiee hunting grounds--you're fortunate to have all your limbs.
You took a risk going there.
Trandoshan arms and legs regrow, Herald. Was worthwhile.
It sounds magnificent indeed.
I wish I'd been with you.
Could have earned many points together, Herald.
Beasts run in Shadowlands that live nowhere else. I thought I knew all.
But one night, enormous beast came to camp and attacked. Beast I could not see.
Don't Trandoshans have infrared vision? You must have seen something.
But you can see in the dark.
Is true, but I saw nothing. Was shadow, barely scent.
I've heard that vicious terentatek hunt in the Kashyyyk Shadowlands.
A dark-side beast, maybe.
These I know. This was something other.
All your stories eventually end the same way.
Let me guess, you killed it.
Spent many days as hunter and hunted, chasing through Shadowlands. But with Scorekeeper's help, I learned creature's movements, sound, spoor.
Finally, I ambushed from above with blade. Beast fell, but... battle took my eye.
That seems a high price to pay for victory.
It's a shame about your eye.
You must have something to show for such a hunt, besides a scar.
Did you get a trophy?
No. Creature fell into Shadowland swamps, and was lost.
Was lesson from Scorekeeper, I think.
Why settle for being half-blind, when there are substitutes available?
You should have it replaced.
Not for me to heal. Injury was lesson from Scorekeeper.
Hunter must have humility, respect prey. Thanks to scar, I always remember.
See, Herald. Was cleaning out pack, and found this.
Is from long-ago hunt. Claw of rancor beast.
From the dark striation on the claw, I'd say this rancor was... male, probably in the prime of life.
I've read much about rancors.
Yes, was so! You have true hunter's knowledge, Herald.
I don't think I've ever heard of a world with rancors this big.
Where did you get it?
From hunt on far away planet. Do not know name.
If that's just the claw, I'd hate to encounter the creature it came from.
That's enormous!
Ha. Beast will no longer trouble anyone.
I was working as bounty hunter, for man named Braden. But I heard of hunting opportunity. Mandalorians, hunting beasts.
I followed Mandalorians to small forest world, and found many rancors, with one giant. Was difficult hunt.
So how do you hunt such a beast?
How did you kill it?
First, planted special karg grease lure--irresistible to rancors. Then built a hide, and got perfect shot.
Such a rancor wouldn't have gone down easily.
I can imagine.
No, rancor dies like any other beast.
A whole planet of rancors and Mandalorians--you must have enjoyed that.
But it must have been fun.
True challenge was Mandalorians. Clumsy. Trampled game trails, lit fires, made hatchling mistakes.
Scorekeeper blessed me. Mandalorians never knew there was other hunter, until they found rancor carcass.
War forces competition. But, war has honed Sith into worthy prey for you, Herald. So all is fortunate.
We don't "hunt" the Sith. We protect innocent people from them, and only kill them when necessary.
Sith aren't our "prey."
Yet Sith force battles, and you earn points. So, Scorekeeper provides.
Imagine. Without the war, there'd be only soft acolytes and crazed hermits to challenge us.
True, I do like fighting Sith.
Is terrible thought. No points in those.
I wouldn't call the deaths of millions of people "fortunate."
What a callous attitude.
Cannot bring back, Herald. Can only make best of what death brings.
Hmm. Rancor claw needs own bag. Memories must be safe.
I'm not interested in your trophies.
I don't care what it is.
Is proof of valor. But is no matter to you.
Is strangeness to travel at Jedi's side. Soft things show you great respect.
Is often problems for my people to travel. Ships do not like Trandoshan passengers.
Often captains say we must pay more, or tell to sleep in cargo hold.
It's shameful such a thing happens in the Republic.
That's a disgrace.
Is fault of some Trandoshans. Thugs, have no honor or goodness. Make worse for everyone.
If you had a starship, you wouldn't have to put up with such nonsense.
Why not get your own ship?
I am hunter, not pilot. Credits must maintain rifles, repair armor, buy supplies. Not go flying.
Trandoshans have a bad reputation in the Republic.
You are a violent species....
I serve Scorekeeper, and hunt with honor. But ship captains? No caring of that.
Always I was "Trandoshan," not Qyzen Fess. Until Yuon Par showed kindness. Was surprise that Jedi understood.
Every culture has something to teach us.
Understanding is what Jedi do.
Was good lesson. Not to judge all as same, like I was judged.
She never told me how you first ran across each other.
How did you meet Yuon?
Was years ago, on Belkadan. Many ruins there, sinking into swamps. Yuon had camp nearby, to study.
First I avoided. Then traded findings from ruins, for snake-bite medicine. Then, stayed to talk at night.
Back then, Yuon had a rather unique perspective on the world.
A crazy Jedi, anyway.
Yuon was always good friend to me. Is my hope you will be, also.
Herald, I have been silent, but now... must speak.
To be Scorekeeper's Herald is great honor, at price of honoring talent and responsibility. You do not do.
I didn't realize my actions were so offensive to you.
I apologize if I upset you.
Is not me you offend, Herald. Is Scorekeeper.
I don't have to behave a certain way, just because your goddess thinks I should.
Your religion doesn't bind me.
If you are Scorekeeper's Herald, must be so. Else you dishonor self, and her.
I'm sure the Scorekeeper can overlook the occasional slipup. I'll make it up to her.
I'll ask forgiveness later.
Scorekeeper is not... plaything to be bought! She is beyond all, and does not forgive!
Please. Is great effort, I know, but Scorekeeper's favor is worth all sacrifice.
Is strangeness how Scorekeeper could mark you as Herald. Is clear you do not deserve.
How could I become more deserving, Qyzen?
And if I wished to change?
Is... is noble question. Must perform deeds that please Scorekeeper. Honorable kills, great achievements, act of penance....
Work will earn lost honor. Is good to seek higher path, Herald.
The fact is that she chose me, whether you approve or not.
I am your Herald. Handle it.
Only proves what I say, "Herald."
I imagine she had her reasons--goddesses are hard to understand.
Yes, it's a great mystery.
I speak of gravest matters, and you laugh.
Maybe Scorekeeper only can see your "worth."
I finally see truth.
I see soft thing in Herald's guise. Serving only itself.
Is sickening Scorekeeper could be so blind.
Perhaps I'm not what you imagined the Scorekeeper's Herald to be. But that's my fault, not the Scorekeeper's.
This is my failing, not hers.
Is... is very hard, to hear wisdom from you.
I can't fight to save the galaxy and stand on a pedestal for you.
Your standards are too high.
I am least of Scorekeeper's hunters, but I do her honor!
I may be a bad Herald, but I'm still the Herald. And you swore obedience.
You still have to serve me.
Is bitter to swallow. But... yes. I did swear.
I will stay on ship. Is still good hunting, if I stomach softness and corruption.
Herald in name, I know truth of you. When Scorekeeper has vengeance, I will be there to see.
Hunter's luck to you.
Herald, must speak with you.
Must speak with you back at ship, Herald.
At your shoulder.
This all shall please Scorekeeper, I hope.
To glory, we walk on together.
Rancor graveyards. Night desert skies. I remember...
Beware. Be vigilant always.
Soft things cannot stand against us.
Devour fear, or be devoured.
Often I think on Yuon's teachings. Great wisdom, and kindness.
To hunt, to serve, is to live.
How is it to be Jedi? What do you see?
Hmph. Skin itches. Perhaps moult comes.
To where now? Prey does not wait.
A moment, to check weapons, then I stand ready.
To be hunter, one must first know silence, stillness, then strength.
